About Me

I like to ask questions and ponder about issues. It can be just a mundane walk that gets me wondering even about traffic lights – How do they stagger adjacent traffic junction timings to ensure smooth flow? How can I understand the effectiveness of this?


It does not stop there. My curiosity inspired my pursuit in Data Analytics. It energizes me to conduct data-driven analysis and make sense of findings to derive meaningful information.


My current focus is in Product Management, where I can build the right tools for the right people. Identifying crucial customer needs and building the products to solve these pain points exhilarate me, because I get to make people's lives easier and better. That is what inspires me.


I am passionate about Fintech, Development Economics and Geospatial Analytics – these are domain areas that inspire some of my problem statements. My interest in these areas gives meaning to the data I work with and drives me to understand more. Here are my projects on topics that interest me. Check it out here!

Work Experience

Aimazing

Product Management Intern

January 2022 - May 2022

Aimazing is a retail analytics company that enables mall management to access business insights from daily transactions, with solutions optimized by machine learning.

  • Leading project to refine error detection technology behind Aimazing’s mall data solution.
  • Identifying key improvement areas through data extraction and analysis with SQL and Python and researching on deep learning for text data.

Circles.Life

Product Management (Australia Growth) Intern

June 2021 - November 2021

Circles.Life is a technology company that offers a fully digital customer experience and a SaaS based ‘Digital Telco as a Service’.

  • Extracted and analyzed monthly churn and NPS survey data to understand customer needs and develop user stories.
  • Collaborated with market research and design for user validation, user flow and prototyping of both products. I worked closely with the UX research to craft survey and interview questions to validate and test product ideas.
  • Bridged communication between design and engineering regarding user experience and solutioning capabilities during grooming. During product development, I documented product requirements and clarified concerns from various teams, such as Product Design, Engineering, Marketing and Quality Assurance.
  • Developed product requirement documents, pitch decks and FAQs for the upcoming product launches. Worked with QA to check use cases for production and highlight bugs for fixing.
  • Initiated and led the review of the end-to-end customer lifecycle for communications. Worked closely with the Customer Relationship Management Lead and the Customer Experience Product Managers, where I consolidated 100+ active triggers from 500+ notification triggers.
  • Took charge of weekly customer-facing issues escalated by customer service leads, engaging the relevant engineering and business team members to solve customer-impacting problems.

1982 Ventures

Analyst Intern

December 2020 - February 2021

1982 Ventures is a Singapore based VC firm focused on investing in early stage fintech start-ups in Southeast Asia.

  • Evaluated investment pitches, performed due diligence and research for potential investments in Southeast Asia region, providing managing partners with summarized insights of current deal flow and market environment.
  • Performed detailed company analysis to prepare investment memos for portfolio companies in Southeast Asia Fintech industry.
  • Initiated and built entry system on Excel to streamline deal sourcing process, now adopted as a standard entry system.

Managing in a VUCA Context

Ernst & Young

Financial Services Advisory (Technology Risk) Intern

December 2019 - April 2020

EY Technology Risk department provides technology risks solutions to clients through delivering services on the design and implementation of controls to mitigate risks in applications, infrastructure and data.

  • Evaluated business risks surrounding implementation and operation of IT systems, analysing risks and impacts of IT policy control weaknesses for financial institution clients.
  • Performed reviews on service controls intended to meet the criteria set forth in regulations such as MAS Technology Risk Management Guidelines (TRM) and NIST Cybersecurity Framework to refresh IT policies for client
  • Analysed client’s IT policies for control gaps to prepare for transition under the newly enacted Payment Services Act.
  • Managed project deliverables from offsite overseas function members, delegating work and ensuring timely delivery.

Unequal Development of Brazil Municipalities

This exploratory data analysis project aims to determine factors affecting the unequal development of Brazil at the municipality level.

The relationship between explanatory variables and GDP per capita is modelled by a multi-linear regression model, where some variables undergo transformation to better fit the model. To account for spatial autocorrelation between municipalities, Geographically Weighted Regression is adopted in formulating the linear model.

R Data Wrangling Data Visualization Geographically Weighted Regression Geospatial Analysis

Exploratory Data Analysis: Airbnb

This project explores the distribution of Airbnb listings.

Spatial point patterns are visualized with dot density and kernel density maps to check for cluster patterns.

To confirm the significance of clustering patterns, null hypotheses will be formed and tested for identified subzone.

R Data Wrangling Data Visualization Probability Density Estimation Geospatial Analysis

Upcoming: Social Area Analysis in Singapore

This project aims to segment Singapore at the planning subzone level into homogeneous socioeconomic areas by combining geodemographic data and geospatial data.

Using hierarchical clustering and spatially contrained clustering (SKATER), we will analyze homogeneous socioeconomic attributes within clusters and delineate social areas.

R Data Wrangling Data Visualization Hierarchical Clustering Spatially Constrained CLustering (SKATER)

Upcoming: Land Use Analysis of Bukit Merah

This project aims to analyse the changing demographics and current land use of Bukit Merah subzone.

Upon analysis of the population demographics, residential locations, and location and accessibility of facilities, this drives the recommendation of spaces suitable for new facilities to cater to the changing needs of residents.

ArcGIS R
